conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. An applied technique is proposed for modeling of microwave ovens with perforated regions of metal walls. The technique relies on replacement of perforated segments by solid surfaces with identical electric conductivity obtained by FDTD simulation of a perforated sheet in a waveguide. The approach is used in modeling of a microwave oven with two perforated segments and shows their negligible impact on the frequency characteristics of |S11| so they can be replaced in the model by solid PEC sheets.

title: A review of reserch about the brake noise of vehicle in China
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electrical and Control Engineering
abstract: This paper is an overview of research about the brake noise of vehicle in the past two years in china. First, a brief introduction to noise threat and research significance of brake noise of vehicle is given. Meanwhile, a brief introduction to the basic principle of the brake noise of vehicle is introduced. Then, the research of brake noise of vehicle in the past two years in china is presented and discussed. Finally, the paper gives a summary of the research status and prospects of brake noise of vehicle.

title: Using SystemVerilog assertions to relate non-cycle-accurate to cycle-accurate designs
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE International High Level Design Validation and Test Workshop
abstract: The problem of the exact temporal relationship between a non-cycle-accurate and a cycle-accurate design is discussed. A non-cycle-accurate design is transformed into a set of equivalent SystemVerilog assertions. An interpretation schema is defined for the translation of these assertions into the time-dimension of the cycle-accurate design. The assertions are then co-simulated or verified. The conditions are identified under which the method is compositional.

title: A very low phase-noise voltage-controlled-oscillator at X-band
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. An X-band VCO is designed using a compact tunable high-Q negative-R resonator. The proposed resonator is a reactively-terminated active band-pass filter, which provides high frequency-selectivity and, at the same time, initiates and sustains the oscillation. This approach results in a simple and compact VCO structure. The fabricated VCO operates at 8.2 GHz with 105 MHz tuning range and a measured phase-noise of −149.5 dBc/Hz at 1 MHz. The VCO achieves record values for phase-noise and FOM.

title: New compensating method for switch sensor based on predictive model in railway maintenance and monitoring system
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electric Information and Control Engineering
abstract: Although the railway switch sensor can measure the switch in real time, its measuring stability is still a problem. To reduce the dynamic measuring error in railway switch sensor, the switch sensor collecting circuit is analyzed, a predictive control method is introduced and an identified model of hall sensor in real time is built. At last, a new predictive compensating model is designed, which can improve the switch sensor dynamic performance. Thus this will make it easy to be applied in railway signalling.

title: Intelligent optimal tuning of hydraulic turbine governor PID gains based on nonlinear model
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: Based on the hydraulic-mechanincal-electrical mathematical models provided by IEEE working group, the non-elastic water hammer effect was consided for hydro turbine regulating system of single-machine and single-conduit without surge tank. And then, genetic algorithm was applied to optimal tuning of hydraulic turbine governor PID gains. The computer simulation results indicate the effectiveness of the optimal results.

title: Measuring the quality characteristics of assembly code on embedded platforms
conferenceTitle: 2011 19thTelecommunications Forum (TELFOR) Proceedings of Papers
abstract: The paper describes the implementation of programming tool for measuring quality characteristics of assembly code. The aim of this paper is to prove the usability of these metrics for assessing the quality of assembly code generated by C Compiler for DSP architecture in order to improve the Compiler. The analysis of test results showed that the compiler generates good quality assembly code.

title: An introduction to solvers
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE Vehicle Power and Propulsion Conference
abstract: The paper is about implement complex nonlinear and/or piecewise functions without complex block diagrams; model custom components and controls; generate efficient sequencing with exact but flexible time step control; state machine modeling; incorporate external C code for hardware controllers.

title: Numerical study on scale of high speed train model for wind tunnel testing
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electrical and Control Engineering
abstract: -Wind tunnel testing is the effective method to research high speed train aerodynamics. It is one of the key steps to ascertain the model scale for wind tunnel testing, because scaled model is always introduced into wind tunnel testing, due to the huge body. Based on the structure of aerodynamic and aero-acoustic wind tunnel, using computational fluid dynamics (CFD), focus on middle car of three connected vehicles, the force variation principle of 1/8, 1/7, 1/6 scaled models were calculated. By researching the 3-D force variation principle of the middle car in different yawing angle, it is certain that in the case of head orientation, the force variation principle of three scaled models is similar and that 1/6 scaled model is more adapt for force testing of middle car of three connected vehicles.

title: Influence brought about by cutter distortion in exact NC lathe physical simulation
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government (ICEE)
abstract: According to the materials of the part and cutter, taking the cutting parameter into account, this paper calculates the cutting-force and cutting-journey using experience formula, calculates the distortion quantity considering the actual instance when machining, calculates the cutter's distortion quantity when heated according to the cutting-heat produced during cutting process, analyzes the cutter's distortion when forced after predigesting the mechanics model, then forecasts the machining error brought out by the displacement change between cutter and part. Based on Windows and Visual C++, the system is developed by C++ language, and instructs Matlab to draw curve according to the result calculated by the mathematical model in order to manifest the simulation results in the pattern of data and curve.

title: Research on the health monitoring for long span bridge in China
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electric Technology and Civil Engineering (ICETCE)
abstract: Health monitoring is playing an increasingly important role with the rapid development of long span bridge. This paper introduces the definition, basis, monitoring contents and system components of the health monitoring for long span bridge at first, and then analyze the current methods commonly used in bridge health monitoring, Finally, probe the current problems of the health monitoring for long span bridge in China.

title: Radar proximity fuzing and the Cold War paradigm
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. This paper is an overview of the history of radar proximity fuze design with emphasis on fuzing designs for nuclear missiles & how the Cold War paradigm drove the requirements. Also covered is a discussion on the Cold War “chess game” driving the escalation of electronic counter measures, electronic counter-counter measures, etc. The focus is on design approaches used in the technically challenging era of the 1950s and early 1960s before the invention of integrated circuits & processors.

title: Research on the method of measuring the inertia moment of engine
conferenceTitle: 2011 Second International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: Inertia moment of engine is a quite important parameter for power measuring without load,instantaneous speed calculating and in cylinder pressure reconstruction. In order to get this important parameter, a new method named instantaneous speed fluctuation comparison is brought out. The detail theory and approach is introduced. After experiment on the 6135 disel, the validity of the method is proved, and the error of the method is analyzed.

title: Fusion method of PCA and BP neural network for face recognition
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: Firstly the function of principal component analysis (PCA) and back propagation (BP) neural network are analyzed in this paper, the fusion method of PCA and BP neural network is proposed for face representation and recognition. Experiments are done on ORL face databases and compare the average recognition rate and training time. Experimental results show that the method achieves the higher recognition accuracy than PCA and BP neural network alone, and Shorten the learning time of the network.

title: Research of web recruitment information extraction based on NLU
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: With the rapid development of Internet technology, network has become main source of recruitment information. How to extract the useful recruitment information automatically from these recruitment websites is an important subject nowadays. This thesis studied processing the half-structure text by Natural Language Understanding and improved the existing language model to realize Chinese named entity recognition. Based on this, the author designed a web recruitment information extraction system. The system has a good extensibility and adaptability and precision and recall can reach above 70%.

title: Active inductor oscillators and noise dynamics
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. The reported oscillator use active inductor topology as a cost-effective alternative to currently available varactor-tuned oscillator (VTO) circuits for the application in third and later generation communication systems. The state-of-the-art technology is analytically validated with CAD-simulated and measured data. It was observed that the classical Leeson phase noise model does not hold good for an active-inductor oscillator; therefore, a unified noise model is needed to explain the discrepancies.

title: Optimal design of a linear induction motor for subway system
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems
abstract: Optimal design by means of finite element models is complex and time consuming. The Efficient Global Optimization (EGO) based on the progressive construction of a Kriging model used to drive the optimization problem allows for an affordable optimization time. In this paper, a linear induction motor (LIM) with double primaries for the subway system is designed, based on the validated 2D finite element model at reduced scale and the tramway's needs. The optimal design problem of LIM is formulated using the rated point design approach and achieved using the EGO algorithm.

title: Research and application on soft soil foundation treatment by static-dynamic drainage consolidation
conferenceTitle: 2011 Second International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: Based on soft soil foundation treatment, the design method and construction parameters of static-dynamic drainage consolidation to treat the soft soil foundation is discussed. Through the data analysis of test and experiment, the results show that the drainage consolidation method of combining static and dynamic is useful to treat soft soil foundation. This research results provide value references for similar engineering.

title: Fault location and classification in distribution systems using clark transformation and neural network [abstract only]
conferenceTitle: 16th Electrical Power Distribution Conference
abstract: In this paper, an accurate method for determination of fault location and fault type in power distribution systems by neural network is proposed. This method uses neural network to classify and locate normal and composite types of faults as phase to earth, two phases to earth, phase to phase. Also this method can distinguish three phase short circuit from normal network position. In the presented method, neural network is trained by αβ space vector parameters. These parameters are obtained using clarke transformation. Simulation results are presented in the MATLAB software. Two neural networks (MLP and RBF) are investigated and their results are compared with each other. The accuracy and benefit of the proposed method for determination of fault type and location in distribution power systems has been shown in simulation results.

title: The design of five-stage pipeline CPU based on MIPS
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electrical and Control Engineering
abstract: Pipeline is one of the basic techniques to improve the CPU's performance. This paper based on MIPS instruction set, designed a five-stage pipeline CPU. The CPU was implemented with schematic and VHDL language, and verified the CPU core is correct and effective in Quartus II environment.

title: Real-time improvement of VCPU scheduling algorithm on Xen
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: CPU virtualization is one of the core elements of server virtualization, whether efficiently, safety scheduling VCPU running on the physical CPU drastically impact the performance of the system. This study found that the existing scheduling algorithms for real-time system are complicated, and CPU utilization is not high; and general-purpose scheduling algorithm's parameter settings is quite simple, but not for realtime applications. Therefore, this paper combines the advantages of various scheduling algorithms, proposes an improved scheduling algorithm, which targets for real-time system, while improving CPU utilization.

title: Image edge detection based on otsu and rough set theory
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: A new algorithm of image edge detecting was proposed, which was based on otsu method and the set's approximation of rough set theory. Firstly, the global threshold of image segmenting was selected through otsu technique for this algorithm. Then there was a 3*3 pixels window, according to the attributes of the relations between threshold and window pixels' grey levels to build decision table. It could deduce the upper approximation and the lower approximation of image edge sets. And at last, the edge image was obtained using the difference between the two approximation sets. The experimental result shows that the method can successfully preserve the image edge details, make the edge image meticulous and vivid, and have powerful ability in its resistance against noise pollution and better continuity and closure.

title: Design of 1.2GHz bandwidth digital-correlator in fully polarimetric microwave radiometer
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electric Information and Control Engineering
abstract: To get all the four Stokes parameters and ocean surface field, abroad band digital correlator used in polarization radiometer was introduced in the paper. Two high-speed A / D converter (ADC08D1500) are used to sample four signal channels at the same time with 1.2GHz sampling rate and 8 effective bits. The sampling results are operated in the newest Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA)-Virtex5 from Xilinx to make correlation calculation. The structure of interfacing circuit and control system of the main modules are presented in detail. The measure result is also given. The power of the whole system is 13.5W.

title: Study on microstructure and mechanical properties of aseismic reinforcement Nb microalloying steel
conferenceTitle: 2011 Second International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: Based on the experimental analysis, the composition design and strengthening mechanism of the Nb microalloying rebar was mainly researched, then the effect of micro Nb on the microstructure and mechanical properties of carbon steels was discussed. The results have been shown that: The grain size could become smaller by Nb microalloying, therefore the strength and plasticity improved evidently, and the microstructure is composed of ferrite and pearlite. The micro Nb in steel could not only improve the mechanical properties but also reduce the cost. There are some practical value in environment protection and resources. The results of this experiment will have a greater role in guiding the actual production.

title: Ultra-wideband radar imaging and live-being detection research in Lithuania
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. In this article, we present recent achievements in UWB measurements in Lithuania. The main purposes of those measurements are to prove the feasibility of detecting objects behind non-metallic barriers and to characterize them. Different UWB measurements techniques (ISAR, SAR, MIMO - radar systems) allow us to draw images of objects, as well as to analyze small motions of objects and to measure the rate of respiration and heart-beat.

title: E-commerce seller credit comprehensive evaluation model
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: This paper analyzes the problems of the main credit evaluation model and established an improved comprehensive evaluation model for C2C e-commerce credit; The improved model is based on the main indicators of the current credit evaluation: product quality, logistics, and service attitude, and comprehensive considerate the impact weights of various indicators; At the same time, We calculate the user's credit with the counterparty creditworthiness number of transactions and transaction amount. For new users, We places the user's level of social credit in place of its initial credit status, and then determine the user's credit rating assessment. This model used to solve the major problem which emerges in current C2C site evaluation model.

title: Control of brushless DC motor with an AVR microcontroller
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Consumer Electronics, Communications and Networks (CECNet)
abstract: This paper illustrates the basic work principle of a brushless DC motor and presents its control method. According to the method, a control system of a brushless DC Motor is designed using an AVR microcontroller. Design of the control system includes hardware circuit designing and software programming. The hardware structure of the control system consists of a microcontroller ATmega64, power supply circuit, position detection circuit, current chopper circuit, power driving circuit, display circuit and keyboard circuit and so on. The software is developed by c program language. The software includes main program, initialization program, PWM duty ratio reload program, speed calculation program, closed-loop PID regulation program, interrupt service program, LCD display program, keyboard program etc. The experiment result shows that the system is with an excellent dynamic and static performance. Its operation is reliable.

title: Power system stability analysis and control based on PMU
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: In allusion to the “on-line beforehand decision-making, real time matching”, this paper proposes the stability control flow based on PMU for interconnected power system, which is a real-time stability control. In this scheme, preventive control, emergency control and corrective control are designed to a closed-loop rolling control process, it will protect the stability of power system. Then it ameliorates the corrective control process, and presents a new control method which is based on PMU and EEAC method. This scheme can ensure the real-time quality and advance the veracity for the corrective control.

title: A linear regression inverse space mapping algorithm for EM-based design optimization of microwave circuits
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. A new simplified formulation for inverse space mapping optimization of microwave circuits is presented in this work. In contrast to previous inverse space mapping algorithms, where artificial neural networks are trained to approximate the inverse space mapping at each iteration, our approach makes use of a linear regression formulation to calculate in closed form the inverse mapping parameters at each iteration. Our technique is illustrated by the EM-based design of several microstrip circuits.

title: Non-redundant synthesis of filters with dual-mode and triple-mode stepped impedance resonators
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. In this paper, network models of the multi-mode-resonator filters and conventional parallel-coupled-line filters are shown to be equivalent. Non-redundant design procedure is proposed and design equations are then derived based on broadband approximate design procedure. Two design examples are given to show that the proposed design procedure is much simpler and yields responses just as good as those obtained by more tedious exact synthesis.

title: Research on Supply Chain Management in enterprises based on E-commerce
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: E-commerce era brings much change in Supply Chain Management. It's a trend now for enterprises to employ E-commerce Supply Chain Management to maintain the competitive advantage. The paper introduce the basic model of Supply Chain Management in depth, and analyzes the relatedness of E-commerce and Supply Chain Management, therefore statements the integration model of E-commerce and Supply Chain Management.

title: Advanced microwave technologies for smart flexible satellites
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. The continuous evolution of payload requirements involves providing more flexibility, higher power, and wider bandwidth. Key challenges to satellite microwave technology are the development of higher power amplifiers, wider bandwidth devices, flexible components such as tunable local oscillators and tunable filters, and reconfigurable antennas. A smart combination of existing and emerging microwave technologies can cost effectively provide various degrees of mission and payload flexibility.

title: Construction of deep web information retrieval system in e-commerce field
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government (ICEE)
abstract: With the increasing number of e-commerce sites, how to get a quick search about the information you want from thousands of e-commerce networks is becoming an urgent problem. In this paper, we present a solution to this problem, first, domain knowledge is established according to the e-commerce field, then we build a deep web information retrieval system based on e-commerce to help users find the goods they want quickly from different e-commerce sites, this system is established by deep web interface extraction, interface integration and interface AutoFill technology.

title: Research progress on corn starch wastewater treatment process
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on New Technology of Agricultural
abstract: The reclamation approaches and treatment technology process of corn starch wastewater were reviewed. contamination Characteristic of corn starch wastewater were concentration high and biodegradable, and the reclamation potential was huge. Treatment technologies included biological treatment, physical chemistry treatment, biological pond and photosynthetic bacteria process. The optimized combine treatment process of resource reclamation from corn starch wastewater and treatment technology was recommended.

title: Sales effort competition in dual-channel supply chain based on a weakest retailer
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: The existence of both traditional market and electronic market complexities supply chain sales effort competition. A weaker online manufacturer who sells products in the internet only, at the same time the manufacturer lbeing a leader shares electronic markets and owns its weakest retailer in the traditional market. Focusing on sales effort, the paper finds out their optimal decisions, and conditions in which supply chain coordinates. After that, it analyses how manufacturers l' channel sales effort effect affects three enterprises' optimal revenues, optimal prices, etc.

title: Filtering speckle noise in SAS images to improve detection and identification of seafloor targets
conferenceTitle: OCEANS 2011 IEEE - Spain
abstract: Multiplicative speckle noise is always present in synthetic aperture sonar (SAS) images, which is due to the coherent nature of scattering phenomena. Many methods that reduce speckle noise while preserving texture and detail have been developed for SAR and presented in the literature. In this paper, some speckle reduction techniques from SAR images are adapted and applied to SAS high resolution images. A comparison of different methods is performed and new improvements for traditional methods are introduced, considering image quality and better Speckle Suppression Index (SSI). These methods include mean adaptive filter, anisotropic diffusion, Lee filter, Kuan filter and a wavelet-based methodology, which are applied to real SAS high resolution (HR) data collected by NATO Underwater Research Center (NURC) during the COLOSSUS measurement campaign.

title: A digital watermarking algorithm based on wavelet transform and arnold
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: Watermarking provides an efficient method for copyright protection. This paper discusses the digital watermark technology which is based on Arnold and wavelet transform. After the Arnold transform of embedded watermark information, then embeds it into host gray images with discrete wavelet transform. Emulational experiments are done in Matlab, Experimental results demonstrate that this watermarking algorithms have better effect: The watermark is invisible and robust against kinds of classical attacks.

title: A vertical integration of high-Q filters with patch antennas for enhanced bandwidth and high efficiency
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. A new approach to integrate high quality(Q)-factor 3-D vertical cavity filters with patch antennas into a single unit is presented in this paper. This integrated filter/antenna system exhibits small footprint, high efficiency, and enhanced bandwidth. The patch antenna is designed to provide an additional transmission pole for the filtering function and works as a highly efficient radiator. In addition, this integrated patch antenna with filter exhibits an enhanced bandwidth.

title: [PDF Not Yet Available In IEEE Xplore]
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE 37th Annual Northeast Bioengineering Conference (NEBEC)
abstract: The document that should appear here is not currently available.

title: Implementation of ZRTP protocol for protection multimedia session
conferenceTitle: 2011 19thTelecommunications Forum (TELFOR) Proceedings of Papers
abstract: This work presents the advantages of ZRTP protocol when it is used for the improvement of the safety of multimedia sessions where one of the components is a voice transmission, together with a presentation of one of the possible software solutions.

title: Double ridged horn antenna designs for wideband applications
conferenceTitle: 2011 19th Iranian Conference on Electrical Engineering
abstract: Summary from only given. In this paper, different double ridged horn antenna (DRHA) designs are investigated for wideband applications. A classic design of 1–18 GHz DRHA with exponential ridges is modelled and the antenna pattern deficiencies are detected at frequencies above 12 GHz. The antenna pattern is optimized by modification of the antenna structure. However, the impedance matching is affected and the VSWR is increased at the frequencies below 2 GHz. The matching problem can be resolved by adding lossy materials to the back cavity of antenna. We have shown reduction of the antenna efficiency by 15% over the whole frequency range, except at the lower frequencies.

title: The vehicle-borne electronic image stabilization system based on Gray Projection Algorithm
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electric Information and Control Engineering
abstract: This paper proposes a vehicle-borne electronic image stabilization system which is based on Gray Projection Algorithm(GPA). This system can be less affected by image noise because of the use of GPA. It also reduces the influence to the translational motion caused by image rotating. Unlike previous electronic image stabilization systems, the developed system can divide the global translational vector into dither vector caused by pavement irregularity and vehicle's motion vector. According to different dither vectors, the size of output images will be designed differently. Finally, the experiment indicates that a smooth video can be reached. This is a feasible method with high accuracy.

title: Application of discrete tracking differentiator to electronic control system of diesel engine
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electric Information and Control Engineering
abstract: In this paper, a new method, based on tracking differentiator (TD), of control algorithm for the electronic controlled VE fuel pump is proposed. Using TD at the input port to provide the transition process for target position can effectively decrease the percent overshoot caused by step input of control variable. Using TD at the output port to track the signal of actuator can decrease the effects of disturbance caused by oil pressure in high speed rotation. Matlab simulation and the practical application results show that the algorithm is feasible and effective.

title: Mixed with lime powder on the performance test of autoclaved concrete
conferenceTitle: 2011 Second International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: In this paper, lime powder used as a concrete admixture, under the conditions in the autoclave process technology, adding lime powder on the compressive strength of concrete measured results show that the prestressed concrete pile to meet the conditions of autoclave curing production request, adding no more than 4% of the lime powder can significantly increase the strength of concrete.

title: Broadband reconfigurable matching network of reduced dimensions for the UHF military satellite communication band
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. A good impedance match between a transmitter and an antenna is essential to achieve power efficiency and maximize the effective radiated power. In portable scenarios, the antenna impedance is usually subject to wide variations, mostly due to its interaction with nearby objects. This paper presents a reconfigurable, low loss matching network that provides a wide range of impedance match over a bandwidth that exceeds one octave. Experimental results are provided for the 220 to 450 MHz band.

title: Comparison of sub-models of Heat transfer in network model of fire
conferenceTitle: 2011 Second International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: Three sub-models of heat transfer across wall in network model of fire are analyzed. The software predictions with the three methods are compared with data of Japan one another by illustration. It shows that for three-node simple building, Both of half-infinite heat transfer sub-model and finite heat transfer sub-model agree well with the data of Japan, half-infinite heat transfer sub-model has a temperature deviation of less than 5% with finite heat transfer sub-model, While the method of heat insulation more than 40%.

title: Centrifuge modeling test of dynamic response and deformation law of concrete-faced rockfill dam under different input waves
conferenceTitle: 2011 Second International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: The study on dynamic response of CFRD is presented using 50g-t centrifuge shaking table in Tsinghua university subjected to sine wave and Parkfield earthquake wave. The experiment is conducted under the 50g condition. Acceleration time histories are recorded by acceleration transducer at different locations on the model and the deformation of the face-slab is also measured. The vibration response and deformation law of CFRD is studied by changing the waveform of input wave. The results show that the waveform of the input wave has considerable influence on the dynamic response of CFRD.The acceleration amplication effect,deformation of the dam, the stress and strain of the face slab subjected to Parkfield earthquake wave is greater than that of sine wave.The stress and the flexural torque in the middle and upper part of face slab is rather significant.

title: Mathematical function recognition and its visualization system based on Web
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: This paper presents a generic programming method for solving a class of uncertain mathematical problem using a cross-platform C/C++ computing environment called Ch. Ch supports computational arrays, a graphical plotting library, and advanced numerical functions for solving complicated problems in engineering and science conveniently. In the proposed method, a mathematical model is described as a string pattern, and is submitted to a code generator as input parameters. Code generators automatically generate coding scheme and call scripting engine to execute code, and return results. Furthermore, this paper describes a flexible programming scheme design on the mathematical functions visualization. Experimental results show that this method is convenient and feasible.

title: Sale forecasting method in dynamic environment based on ARMA(1,1)
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electric Information and Control Engineering
abstract: Sale forecasting is a difficult thing because of the dynamic sale environment and inefficient sale structure. Considering the short of circle and irregular factor in multiplication model, this paper uses the ARMA (1,1) model to forecast the circle and irregular factor separated from multiplication model. The method is proved effective according to result of the contrast analysis on sale data of 27 month of some product. The use of the method can improve the forecasting accuracy and has great significance for making plan of manufacturing and purchase.

title: Modeling of microwave pyramidal absorbers using artificial neural networks
conferenceTitle: 2011 19thTelecommunications Forum (TELFOR) Proceedings of Papers
abstract: In this paper, a possibility of employing artificial neural networks in evaluation of microwave pyramidal absorbers' performance is presented. The developed neural model predicts reflection coefficient of the absorber at different incident angles and operating frequencies, for horizontally polarized EM wave. Efficiency and simplicity of determining the reflection coefficient present main advantage of the proposed neural model in regard to complex electromagnetic models.

title: Object recognition and centroid detection based on machine vision
conferenceTitle: 2011 Second International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: Machine vision based on image processing, pattern recognition, computer technology and physiology, exploit computer simulation human brain to process, understanding, description visual the information extracted, is an important branch of artificial intelligence. This paper Proposes a object recognition and centroid detection method based on the machine vision, send the centroid of each extracted object to controller of the Mechanical arm in factory production line, which is used to sort and package the actual industrial production automatically .

title: Notice of Retraction: Research on government information Rent-Seeking and response measures
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government (ICEE)
abstract: Retracted.

title: The modeling and simulation for wind model of wind power
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electrical and Control Engineering
abstract: The correct model of wind speed is of great significance to wind power research, it can not only reflect the actual wind speed changes, but also provide the accurate parameters for the simulation and the study on the wind power system. This paper uses four wind speed component combination wind speed mathematical model, and uses Matlab/Simulink to build simulation model, the simulation results show that the mathematical model can accurately reflect the mutation, the gradual nature and randomness of the wind speed.

title: Lightweight design of all-terrain vehicle's frame
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electric Information and Control Engineering
abstract: Based on the FEM, we chose 4 typical working conditions called horizontal bending, limited torsion, bending and torsion, and impact load, and analysed the frame's static and dynamic characteristics by using OptiStruct to get the results of structural stress, stiffness and the first ten free modals. According to the results, we constructed the mathematical optimization model and FEM for size optimization, and optimized the frame's thickness. Through the optimal dates, we checked the dynamic and static characteristics to validate the feasibility. Thus, we realize lightweight design requirements of this all-terrain vechicle's frame.

title: Application of Proteus software in MCU teaching
conferenceTitle: 2011 Second International Conference on Mechanic Automation and Control Engineering
abstract: Proteus is a kind of powerful EDA simulation software. The large device library and the dynamic peripherals are the special advantage of this software. The virtual instrument brings great convenience to the simulation process Applied Proteus software in MCU teaching, the cost is reduced and the effect is improved. This paper introduces Proteus software application and practice method in theoretical and practical teaching about MCU.

title: Green Building Assessment System Considering the durability of structures
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electric Technology and Civil Engineering (ICETCE)
abstract: Some basic features of the green building assessment systems in the USA, UK and Japan were compared firstly in this paper, from which it was found to be necessary to develop an appropriate green building assessment system with consideration of the specific situations in China. In order to describe the variation of assessment grade during the life-cycle of green buildings entirely, a new green building assessment system with three indices (including the quality, load and durability indices) was established based on the existing two indices system (Green Olympic Building Assessment System with only the quality and load indices). The durability of structures is considered in the new assessment system and therefore the building assessment and structural assessment can be unified for the green buildings.

title: Economic analysis of Green building technology based on incremental cost
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electric Technology and Civil Engineering (ICETCE)
abstract: From the point of green building's life cycle, the incremental cost of its each technical measure was analysed, at the same time, efficiency evaluation of Green building was built to evaluate its economic rationality. At last, combined actual case to analyse the economic benefit of green building, which will be all-right to promote the development of green building.

title: Compact dual-mode dual-band microstrip bandpass filter
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electronics, Communications and Control (ICECC)
abstract: A new type dual-mode dual-band bandpass filter is proposed in this letter. This filter has two merits. First, the size of this dual-mode microstrip filter is smaller than the conventional dual-mode filters. The proposed structure of the filter is able to achieve 60% size reduction comparing to the traditional structure. In the second, there are a pair of transmission zeros closely to every pass band. Therefore, the selectivity of the filter can be improved. The transmit performance of this filter is simulated by a high frequency full-wave simulator (Ansoft HFSS). It is shown that this structure can generate two operating modes, i.e., the even mode and the odd mode. Finally an experimental filter was fabricated and measured to demonstrate the design. The measured results agree well with the simulated one.

title: The design of NN type planetary gear reducer for servo motor
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electrical and Control Engineering
abstract: The servo motor is widely used in the numerical control system, in order to reduce speed and increase torque, reducer with small volume and large transmission ratio is needed.Planetary gear reducer with two internal gear pairs is known as NN type reducer,it has the advantage of small volume and large transmission ratio so that it is a very suitable selection. This paper takes the reducer design with large transmission ratio (100) as an example, introduces the key technique of the design for NN type reducer, such as the choice of the tooth number, the calculation of the internal meshing gear pairs and the design of the balance structure, provides a clear train of thought and some efficient design method.

title: A novel MEMS-based tunable dielectric resonator filter
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. This paper presents a new class of high-Q tunable dielectric resonator filters based on MEMS switches. The filter consists of two disk shape dielectric resonators with circular holes created in the center of each resonator. An initial prototype of the filter is assembled. The filter operates in TME mode at 4.8 GHz with a bandwidth of 21 MHz. Measurement results of this prototype demonstrate a tuning range of 160 MHz while the quality factor ranges from 1200–510 over the tuning range.

title: Selecting methods and its application for partners of agricultural supply chain based on Support Vector Regression
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: To reduce the costs of the agricultural supply chain, and reduce the uncertain effect in the agricultural supply chain, it has to analyze, appraise and select the partners of agricultural supply chain according to scientific methods. After simply introducing the theory of Support Vector Regression (SVR), then construct the index system for selecting the partners of agricultural supply chain. Based on the grades that the expert's graded, and tested by real example, the results shows that the Support Vector Regression (SVR) is one of the effect methods for selecting the partners of agricultural supply chain.

title: An outlook on network honeypot
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: This paper introduced network honeypot technology, from the honeypot bait, detection technology, recording of a detailed analysis of three aspects of the network honeypot operation mechanism, discussed the value, strengths and weaknesses of network honeypot technology, analyzed the offensive and defensive technology game in a network honeypot system, and looked forward to the core technology trends and the challenges for it.

title: Introduction to advanced automotive batteries
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE Vehicle Power and Propulsion Conference
abstract: The paper is about types of batteries; basic electrochemistry; battery construction; battery performance and sizing; life and durability; battery system integration; safety and abuse.

title: Maximizing DC power in energy harvesting circuits using multi-sine excitation
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. This paper presents an approach to signal excitation specially designed to improve the DC power obtained in a RF to DC converter and consequently its RF-DC efficiency conversion. In this sense, a multi-sine signal is used as the excitation, and it is proved either theoretically, by simulations and by measurements, that a multi-sine signal with 0° phase relationship between the tones present better DC values in energy harvesters, when compared with a single tone excitation with the same input power

title: The revelation on sustainable traffic system of Lund in Sweden
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electric Technology and Civil Engineering (ICETCE)
abstract: Lund, situated in the centre of Oresund region, is one of the oldest cities in Sweden. This city has earned a reputation as "Euro culture capital" and" inovation centre" depending on its well known Lund University and serious world famous companies nearby. The city aims at sustainable traffic programme to develop an integrated, environmentally friendly traffic system. This paper discuss and introduces a series of viewpoints technical measures and strategies in Lund, such as:the sustainable traffic(train, bus, bicycle) network; parking spots plan; green motors and fuels; sustainable designing of traffic construction, etc. Comparing with Chinese traffic situation, some personal advices are also put forward.

title: Hierarchical sliding-mode control of bicycle robot system
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: Dynamic model of the bicycle robot is made by methods based on Lagrangian and using multi-sliding surface of the Hierarchical sliding-mode method controls non-linear underactuated bicycle robot system. This method divided system states into two sub-systems. Two first-level sub-sliding planes are designed, and then the second-level sliding plane is constructed. The ultimate sliding-mode control law is obtained by using Lyapunov stability theorem. The Hierarchical sliding-mode controller have the bicycle robot controlled effectively, which has been verified in the simulation experiment.

title: A Jess knowledge-based data quality analyzing framework
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government (ICEE)
abstract: Successful data quality analyzing depends on the business rules. We present a knowledge-based framework for data quality analyzing, which carries out the representation of business knowledge by production rules and performs Analysis and cleansing operations automatically by Jess engine driver; The framework provides a systematic approach for domain knowledge representation, supports the complete life-cycle of data quality and is extensible.

title: Comparison on general aviation industry statistics between China and the United States
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: It is important of fundamental statistical information to the development of general aviation industry. Statistics of U.S. general aviation industry have such information as activities of general aviation, aircraft, airports, pilots, security and so on. In contrast, China's general aviation industry is not developed, and statistical information is not perfect. Based on U.S. statistical experience in general aviation industry and China's lack, it gives the ideas and suggestions to improve the statistical information of China's general aviation industry.

title: Improving energy efficiency by heating greenhouse crops with microwaves
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. Heating greenhouse crops with microwaves offers potential improvements in energy efficiency of at least 50%. Presented here are results confirming plants can be grown successfully, and to similar standards as conventionally heated plants, using microwave heating. The performance of the plants is a function of the resultant temperature and the uniformity of the heating pattern within the plant. Heating uniformity can be improved by using circularly polarized incident electric fields.

title: Analysis of U-Boot booting process and the realization of command menu
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electrical and Control Engineering
abstract: Bootloader is a piece of code that runs before any operating system running. It is mainly to initialize hardware, boot the system, download programs into RAM, and so on. U-Boot is one of the most common and powerful Bootloader. Based on S3C2440 SOC, the paper analyzes the U-Boot start-up procedure, and introduces the method that presenting a command menu to select the command for the development board.

title: Notice of Retraction: RSSI based positioning error ranging removal of mixed
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Consumer Electronics, Communications and Networks (CECNet)
abstract: This article has been retracted by the publisher.

title: The achievement of Automatic Parking Control System of lifting and Transferring Stereo Garage based on real-time exchange parking stall
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electric Information and Control Engineering
abstract: This paper discusses in details lifting and transferring Stereo Garage Automatic Parking Control System which consists of IPC+PLC. Bottom PLC control system and top IPC software system are described in details. Adopting Siemens PLC, bottom PLC uses modular ladder program to achieve bottom control and communication with IPC. The top IPC software adopts multithreading technology based on VC6.0 and DAO technology to achieve the maintenance of the garage and the corresponding real-time database management. Finally, Automatic Parking can be realized and applied in real system with high efficiency.

title: Kernel methods and its application in Relation Extraction
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Computer Science and Service System (CSSS)
abstract: Relation extraction aims at discovering relations between entities from free text, and it is a crucial part of information extraction. Recently, kernel methods have seen successfully applied in relation extraction. In this paper, various kernel methods in relation extraction from free text are discussed, including syntactic parsing, kernel functions, as well as their training algorithms. Major difficulties and future research directions are concluded.

title: Longitudinal partitioning based waveform relaxation algorithm for transient analysis of long delay transmission lines
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. In this paper a waveform relaxation algorithm based on longitudinal partitioning is presented. This work models transmission lines as cascade of lumped circuit elements and lossless line segments, where the lossless line segments are modeled using the method of characteristics. This allows the transmission line to be divided into smaller, weakly coupled subcircuits, enabling the algorithm to converge more efficiently than existing relaxation algorithms based on longitudinal partitioning.

title: Compact high-rejection wideband bandpass filter using asymmetrical resonators
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. A compact wideband bandpass filter using asymmetrical resonators is proposed. A lossless transmission-line model calculation is used to determine the resonant responses of the asymmetrical resonator, which consists of a uniform resonator tapped by an open stub. By adjusting the stub length and the tapping position, one can control the resonant frequencies for wideband bandpass filter. With the two inherent transmission zeros, a sharp rejection response is achieved.

title: Speed enhancement technique for divide-by-4 injection-locked frequency divider and its application to fractional division
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. A new cross-coupling method for the design of divide-by-4 injection-locked frequency divider (ILFD) is introduced for increased operation speed with no extra power consumption. Moreover, the proposed cross-coupled divide-by-4 ILFD is extended to the application of fractional divider based upon the phase-switching scheme. A prototype is fabricated in a standard 0.35 µm CMOS process. It exhibits an operation frequency range from 2.26 to 2.67 GHz and consumes less than 3.63 mW with a 1.5 V supply.

title: LQR control of double inverted-pendulum based on genetic algorithm
conferenceTitle: 2011 9th World Congress on Intelligent Control and Automation
abstract: In practice, the key problem to apply LQR optimal control method is how to correctly choose the weighted matrix of performance index. At present, there is no formulaic approach for this problem. To obtain the satisfying results, people must repeat to test many times. This kind of LQR control method based on genetic algorithms, which can obtain satisfying control results at first hand, is presented for double inverted pendulum system. The method optimizes the Q-matrix by using genetic algorithms, selects trace of the result of Riccati equation as the objective function. The control problem of double inverted pendulum is resolved successfully. The simulation results prove that the control effect by this method is better than the other methods mentioned in the references.

title: A regression model on effective exchange rate of RMB based on Random Forest
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government (ICEE)
abstract: RMB exchange rate becomes more uncertain with 2008 financial crisis. The relation between RMB exchange rate and the impact factors is worth to study. In this paper, a regression model between RMB exchange rate and the economic indicators is obtained by Random Forests (RF) method, where the economic indicators is also selected with RF. In addition, the comparison experiments between RF, support vector machine (SVM) and multiple linear regression method show that RF method achieves a better result.

title: The optimal model of integrated with the experts' opinions based on partical swarm optimization
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Electric Information and Control Engineering
abstract: The article studies the method integrated with the experts opinions in the group decision-making, building up an optimal searching mechanism base on Delphi method, deriving an optimal model integrated with opinions of experts base on partical swarm optimization, gaining a consistent and believable conclusion with the help of the computer information processing ability.

title: The finite element analysis of covering effect performance of highway asphalt pavement on subgrade in Xinjiang
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on Remote Sensing, Environment and Transportation Engineering
abstract: Because of the special climate in Xinjiang, the annual evaporation far outweigh the rainfall and temperature gap between day and night, led to the region's highway exist strong pavement covering effect, Through experiment road observation data and finite element analysis of the model, the asphalt pavement layer under the upper humidity than gravel road embankment covering layers of roadbed upper humidity was great, Covering effect performance of asphalt pavement was significant, in road structure design should be considered in pavement covering effect of subgrade moisture influence.

title: Digital predistorted inverse class-F GaN PA with novel PAPR reduction technique
conferenceTitle: 2011 IEEE MTT-S International Microwave Symposium
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. In this paper, a digital predistorted inverse class-F GaN power amplifier with novel PAPR reduction technique is presented, in which not only peaks but also valleys of signal are clipped to reduce the PAPR as much as possible. The inverse class-F PA is implemented with Cree's CGH40010 GaN HEMT which delivers output power of 10 W. For a 20 MHz wideband OFDM signal, adjacent channel power ratio (ACPR) of the proposed PA decreases from −35.4 dBc to −51.9 dBc, and drain efficiency of the PA is 31.3% at an average output power of 33.6 dBm.

title: Architecture and key technologies of learning resource management based on Grid system
conferenceTitle: 2011 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government (ICEE)
abstract: The highly efficient and stable collaborative computation platform for learning resource management can be constructed on the basis of Grid computing technology, combined with Peer-to-Peer (P2P) computing technology. This paper proposed the architecture and key technologies of the Grid incorporated with P2P structure, and correspondingly web services with LDAP access grid node was designed. Learning resource ontology was introduced and used for resource stored and accessed with the WSRF.
